Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp

Class FTPDataConnectionCoordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp.FTPDataConnectionCoordinator
  • public class FTPDataConnectionCoordinator
extends java.lang.Object
    Coordinates data connections between FTP control connections and data transfers.

    This class manages both passive and active mode data connections:

    • Passive Mode: Server creates a listening port, client connects to it
    • Active Mode: Server connects to client's specified port

    The coordinator handles the complex synchronization between:

    • Control connection command processing
    • Data connection establishment
    • File system stream coordination
    • Transfer progress and completion
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Method Detail

      • setDataProtection

        public void setDataProtection​(boolean protect)
        Sets whether data connections should be TLS-protected (RFC 4217 PROT P).
        Parameters:
        protect - true to enable TLS protection for data connections

      • isDataProtectionEnabled

        public boolean isDataProtectionEnabled()
        Returns whether data connections are TLS-protected.
        Returns:
        true if PROT P is active

      • setupPassiveMode

        public int setupPassiveMode​(int port)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Configures passive mode data connection. Creates a server socket that the client can connect to.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to listen on (0 for system-assigned)
        Returns:
        the actual port being used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if passive mode setup fails

      • setupActiveMode

        public void setupActiveMode​(java.lang.String host,
                            int port)
        Configures active mode data connection. Stores client connection info for later use.
        Parameters:
        host - client's host address
        port - client's port number

      • acceptDataConnection

        public void acceptDataConnection​(FTPDataConnection dataConnection)
        Called by FTPDataServer when a client connects in passive mode.
        Parameters:
        dataConnection - the established data connection

      • startTransfer

        public void startTransfer​(FTPDataConnectionCoordinator.PendingTransfer transfer)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Starts a data transfer operation. This handles both passive and active mode coordination.
        Parameters:
        transfer - the transfer details
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if transfer setup fails

      • abortTransfer

        public void abortTransfer()
        Aborts any active transfer.

        Generates PASV response string in the format "227 Entering Passive Mode (h1,h2,h3,h4,p1,p2)".
        Parameters:
        serverAddress - the server's IP address
        Returns:
        formatted PASV response
